alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Perry; Wayne (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 12:04AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lewis, northeastern Wayne and southern Perry Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1203 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Linden, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Flatwoods. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Brief Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
